description:
Description
In 2004, the state of North Carolina released to the public a large dataset
containing information on births recorded in this state. This dataset has
been of interest to medical researchers who are studying the relation
between habits and practices of expectant mothers and the birth of their
children. This is a random sample of 1,000 cases from this dataset.
title: North Carolina births, 1000 cases
reference:
We do not have ideal provenance for these data. For a better
documented and more recent dataset on a similar topic with similar variables,
see births14.

parameters.weight: Weight of the baby at birth in pounds.
parameters.marital: Whether mother is married or not married at birth.
parameters.lowbirthweight:
Whether baby was classified as low birthweight
(low) or not (not low).
parameters.gender: Gender of the baby, female or male.
parameters.visits: Number of hospital visits during pregnancy.
parameters.whitemom: Whether mom is white or not white.
parameters.gained: Weight gained by mother during pregnancy in pounds.
parameters.habit: Status of the mother as a nonsmoker or a smoker.
parameters.premie: Whether the birth was classified as premature (premie) or full-term.

format: A data frame with 1000 observations on the following 13 variables.
